name: Black Forest
hint: Dense forested mountain range in southwestern Germany

name: Scandinavian Fjords
hint: Dramatic glacially carved inlets along Norway's coastline

name: Hungarian Plains
hint: Vast flat grassland in central Hungary, also called the Puszta

name: Iberian Peninsula
hint: Southwestern European peninsula containing Spain and Portugal

name: Alps Region
hint: Highest and most extensive mountain range in Europe

name: Scottish Highlands
hint: Rugged mountainous region of northern Scotland

name: Lapland Tundra
hint: Arctic region in northern Finland and Scandinavia, home of the Sami people

name: Po Valley
hint: Major fertile plain in northern Italy, Italy's agricultural heartland

name: Carpathian Mountains
hint: Eastern European mountain arc stretching from Czech Republic to Romania

name: Mediterranean Coast
hint: Southern European coastline famous for its climate, stretching from Spain to Greece

name: Strait of Gibraltar
hint: Narrow passage connecting the Atlantic Ocean to the Mediterranean Sea

name: English Channel
hint: Body of water separating England from France, crossed by the Channel Tunnel

name: Pyrenees
hint: Mountain range forming the natural border between France and Spain

name: Dolomites
hint: Stunning pale limestone mountain range in northeastern Italy, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

name: Balkan Peninsula
hint: Southeastern European peninsula home to diverse nations from Greece to Slovenia

name: Scandinavian Peninsula
hint: Largest peninsula in Europe, comprising Norway, Sweden, and part of Finland

name: Strait of Messina
hint: Narrow strait separating Sicily from mainland Italy, linked to Scylla and Charybdis myth

name: Amalfi Coast
hint: Spectacular stretch of Italian coastline south of Naples, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

name: White Cliffs of Dover
hint: Iconic chalk cliffs on England's southeastern coast facing France across the Channel

name: Danube Gorge
hint: Dramatic gorge where the Danube cuts through the Carpathians between Serbia and Romania
